meanings.definition: Jibbers (noun): A feeling of fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise gave me the jibbers.
meanings.sent2: She gets the jibbers when she watches scary movies.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house filled with jibbers made everyone scream.
meanings.sent4: The dark forest was full of jibbers lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The jibbers in her stomach made her hesitate before entering the dark room.

meanings.definition: Jibbers (verb): To express fear or anxiety through vocalizations or body language.
meanings.sent1: He jibbers loudly when he sees a spider.
meanings.sent2: The child jibbers and clings to their parent during thunderstorms.
meanings.sent3: The puppy jibbers playfully as it chases its tail.
meanings.sent4: She jibbers with excitement before going on stage.
meanings.sent5: The cat jibbers nervously before being introduced to a new environment.
